Make the game more readable,"As a player, I want a clean user interface to help me find my way around.
Acceptance Criteria

column2: Hits and water should be shown in individual colors
A different color for messages
Individual game steps should be grouped visually
The player should be told exactly what the next possible steps are",,open,,

column1: Indication when a ship has been sunk,"As a player, I want to see which ships of my opponent I have sunk in order to identify which ships I still have to search for.
Acceptance Criteria

column2: Show only ships that have been sunk completely, not which ship was hit
Show me in a way that I can see which ships are left over",,open,,

column1: Game does not end,"Steps to Reproduce

column2: Start a new game
Hit all the computers ships
The game does not end

column1: Acceptance Criteria

column2: When all ships have been sunk, the player sees a message saying, ""You are the winner!"" or ""You lost!""
The game shall end as soon as a player has no more ships left that are not sunk.",,open,,

column1: Validate ship placement,"As a player, I want to make sure that I'm placing all ships according to the rules so that it's a fair game and I can't cheat.
Acceptance Criteria

column2: Ships must not overlap each other
All ships have the correct size
All ships have all positions in a horizontal or vertical row, gaps are not allowed.
If the player tries to set an invalid position, a message appears",,open,,

column1: You can shoot at positions outside the playing field,"Steps to Reproduce

column2: Shoot at position A20
A ""Miss"" is displayed, but a message should appear that this position is outside the playing field and the player can repeat his shot.

column1: Acceptance Criteria
Computer shall place its ships randomly,"As a player, I want the computer to place its ships randomly so that I don't know their position after a few games and  the game becomes more interesting.
Acceptance Criteria

column2: The ships must be placed differently for each game
The placement must comply with the rules
- Ships must not cross each other
- No ships outside the field
- All ships have the correct size
- All ships have all positions in a horizontal or vertical row, gaps are not allowed
The player cannot see the positions of the ships of the computer",,open,,

column1: Computers should shoot smarter,"As a player, I want the computer to shoot smarter so that the game becomes more challenging for me.
Acceptance Criteria

column2: Do not shoot at the same position several times
Searching for a hit in adjacent positions instead of shooting at a completely different location
Search for good shot positions based on remaining ships",,open,,

column1: Make size of the field configurable,"As a player, I want to be able to configure the size of the playing field in order to be able to influence the duration of the game.
Acceptance Criteria

column2: Non-square fields should be allowed
Limit board size to 26 in both directions, otherwise the letters are not sufficient
If board is too small to place all ships, a message should be displayed
The computer should also use the new board size for placement and shooting
I should be able to shoot at all configured fields",,open,,

column1: Make ship positions changeable during placement,"As a player, I want to be able to adjust the positions of my ships during the placement so that I can re-arrange them.
Acceptance Criteria

column2: The changed positions must also be valid.
Changes should only be possible if the game has not yet been started.
The position editing process should be intuitive for the player.",,open,,

column1: Two human players,"As a player, I want to be able to play against other players to have fun together
Acceptance Criteria

column2: Each player should be able to play on his computer
Playing against the computer should still be possible
There are always two players
If there are several players on my network, I want to be able to choose who I want to play against",,open,,

column1: Computer should not shoot at the same position multiple times,"As a player, I don't want the computer to shoot at the same position several times so that its chances of winning increase and the game becomes more challenging to me.
Acceptance Criteria

column2: The computer should not shoot again at a position it has used before
The computer shall fire on all fields of the playing field",,open,,

column1: Computer is supposed to search for adjacent positions after a hit,"As a player, I want the computer to try to sink my ship after a hit to increase its chances of winning and make the game more challenging for me.
Acceptance Criteria

column2: After a hit, the fields at the top / bottom / left / right of the hit should be fired upon
Immediately after another hit has been made on one of the adjacent fields, the orientation of the ship

column1: can be detected and this information should be used for the next shot

column2: If no more hits are scored in the ship's direction and the ship is not yet sunk, then continue shooting

column1: in the other direction from the first hit.

column2: After the ship has been sunk, the next shot position is to be searched randomly on the whole field again
If two ships touch each other, the system must detect this and sink both ships.",,open,,

column1: Computer shall search for good shooting positions based on the remaining ships,"As a player, I want the computer to look for the best possible shot positions to increase its chances of winning and make the game more challenging for me.
Acceptance Criteria

column2: Do not shoot in gaps where there is not enough space for the smallest vessel to be sunk.
Consider gaps in horizontal and vertical direction",,open,,

column1: Cool Happy Ending,"As a player, I want a cool message or something like that when I win the game, so I'm motivated to play the game again.
Acceptance Criteria

column2: The message should be a positive surprise
The message should work on a standard computer and require no special equipment.",,open,,
